definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: That is the cold dish like a salad.
sentences.chinese: 然後做相當於色拉的冷菜。

sentences.english: Why are there a lot more hot dishes than cold dishes in Chinese cuisine?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中國菜裏熱菜比冷菜要多得多？

sentences.english: I've added cold cuts and cheese on them and toasted them in the oven, too.
sentences.chinese: 有時也會加進點冷菜和奶酪然後放進烤箱烤一下。

sentences.english: With delicate children, cold meal is apt to lie heavy on the stomach.
sentences.chinese: 體弱的兒童喫冷飯冷菜更容易滯胃。

definition: appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to smell, look and taste great
dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
a dish that goes well with alcoholic drinks
